text: Passing dictionaries to a Python script through the command line
How can I pass a dictionary to a python script from another python script over the command line?
I use subprocess to call the second script.

The options I've come to are:
I) Build a module to parse a dictionary from a string (more in-depth than I had hoped to go).

II) Use a temporary file to write a pickle, and pass the file's name as an argument
III) Don't allow dictionaries, but handle key/value pairs (that is "prog.py keya valuea keyb valub")
The solution does not have to be user-friendly, but does need to be program friendly.
The second program must be run as a separate process, due to security and resource concerns.
